website_summaries.verdict: This model kit allows you to build  and launch a replica of a U.S. Red Stone rocket.
pros: Lots of great detail on this rocket
Great to display if you don't want to fly
An interesting challenge on an adult level
cons: This rocket is a little difficult to assemble and does not fly as high as other Estes models

customer_reviews.title: Challenging Build, But Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: Challenging build, but follow the instructions and you'll have a beautiful scale rocket. I went on EBay and bought a plastic fin and skin kit that made it easier to build and looked even cooler. Launched this afternoon and it flew perfect. Had a great time building and launching this kit.
customer_reviews.author: David Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: Update from original kit
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this rocket about 10 years ago. That was back when the fins were made of plastic and the body and top of the rocket separated during the recovery phase and both ascended to earth under their own parachutes. Now, this kit has been updated. There were a few pleasant, and challenging surprises. The fins are balsa, but you have to glue two sheets together and then sand the leading edges of the fins. Overall it was a fun build and I look forward to flying it this evening.
customer_reviews.author: talon2king

customer_reviews.title: Building the escape tower is a challenge but with patience it's doable and pretty sturdy once finished
customer_reviews.text: Not a precisely scale model, but for a flying model it's more than satisfying. Building the escape tower is a challenge but with patience it's doable and pretty sturdy once finished. The fins are surprising rugged. Make sure you use the proper C6-3 engines; if you use an engine with a longer delay the rocket may not be high enough for a safe parachute recovery by the time the ejection charge goes off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The red ladder/capsule portion is impossible to assemble no matter how careful you are or how much time spent on it. It's poorly diecast making it impossible to assemble! Minus the entire top area, it's value is half of the asking retail price. The fins are an absolute joke as well. Poor design all the way around! I'm extremely disappointed with my purchase and cannot recommend this Rocket to anyone. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Just Saying

customer_reviews.title: Coolest looking rocket I've built
customer_reviews.text: I really think this is a good looking rocket. It was not, however, easy to build, and the escape tower was particularly tough (and I'm an adult, not a 12 year old). Nevertheless, it was challenging, and very rewarding when it finally came together. And it flew wonderfully. Some rockets might be put together in an hour, but this took time and patience, and it's now on display.
customer_reviews.author: Homer315

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Rocket!
customer_reviews.text: It's an Estes kit, so you know good parts, laser cut, etc. Be extra careful with the decal sheet, it doesn't seem the best. The Mercury capsule is all plastic, not a problem if you've done plastic model kits. Built mine for a static display, although it could fly if ever. The biggest problem will be painting the fins, but again, not a real problem. A fun kit!
customer_reviews.author: Dr_D

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking rocket, would recommend it to others
customer_reviews.text: A nice looking model, Estes suggests it is a level 3 but I think 4 or even 5 might be closer. Building the tower is a little tricky, getting it to stand up straight was the hard part for me. Other than that, beveling the leading edge of the fins is a bit of work too. All worth it, as the finished model looks pretty neat.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed rocket kit, not for the faint of heart.
customer_reviews.text: Ugh this rocket is a pain to build. It's an older model just reissued. It's a level 3 or 4. For example to build thr wood fins need to be glued together. Then filed down to the correct thickness. Then cardboard pieces need to be glued with another wood piece. All of this to make one fin. DO Not get me started on the capsule or escape tower. Trying to glue ill fitting pices to make a cylinder or parts to make a triangle to fit on a circle is ridiculous. Great looking model, not for the faint of heart. Lots of skill is needed. Estes can do better designing this kit.
customer_reviews.author: V. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: was a gift for a friend but the seller is awesome i have bought directly from them and through amazon and always top notch and very fast shipping THANK YOU as always and any estes rocket is a good item more people should look into model rockets to enjoy with kids outside activities and also learn alot from this hobby
customer_reviews.author: billy collins

customer_reviews.title: It is a tough build but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was a tough build. If you want to be challenged a little this one will do it. It is not as bad as some made it out to be. Some that said nose cone was impossible were wrong and maybe a little out of their league.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Crocker

customer_reviews.title: nice model
customer_reviews.text: Awesome model. I am not going to launch this thing. I will use it as a model of the mercury redstone missile- looks nice on the shelf of my USA space collections NASA models.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Product does not match description
customer_reviews.text: Should not have to scroll down to Q&A or 1 star reviews to find after the fact that product doesn't match actual product description. No launcher, engines, launch stand, wadding etc.. only rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Shortinthetoof

customer_reviews.title: Excellelent model
customer_reviews.text: Just leave off the escape tower if you are going to launch it, no way it survives the flight and landing.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Perkins

customer_reviews.title: improve stickers
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Mercury Rocket, but it appears the stickers that help with the visual features were to fragile verses what I have used hundreds of times with Estes rocket kits. Once I got the stickers ready to apply after soaking in water, they tore before I could get them positioned correctly. So I patterned with paint the best I could
customer_reviews.author: William Denison

customer_reviews.title: need other supplies
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with everything needed. Make sure to read details
customer_reviews.author: Emily Wigen

customer_reviews.title: Great Model
customer_reviews.text: I love this model. It is a realistic model of the Mercury redstone. The only problems I had were that the capsule didn't fit into it's base as easily as I would have liked and that it seemed unrealistic to carve the find to s point. (I decided not to do this.) overall it's a really nice model and I would recommend it to anyone who has an interest in the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Challenging build
customer_reviews.text: It has its challenges. The nose tower is the hardest part to get straight
customer_reviews.author: R Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: One of the best model kits I've built. A nice low flyer.
customer_reviews.author: ToneDeafJunior

customer_reviews.title: The nosecone has to be assembled and the do not ...
customer_reviews.text: The nosecone has to be assembled and the do not just "fit together", they require a bit of experience and patience.
customer_reviews.author: charles kroiss

customer_reviews.title: Good kid rocket.
customer_reviews.text: Great starter rocket for my son to work on. Good instructions and great decals and details in the design. Challenging enough to not get boring for an 11 year old, but not too complicated that I had to help a lot. Flew great several times with good durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: the history that this model has in the real world
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of the rocket and his history. As a model rocketry hobbyist, is perfect for the CAP Aerospace education program in my unit.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Ortiz Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT Model for an adult to build and fly (with my children and grandchildren, of course!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so much fun a little challenge putting it to gather but great fun
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mathews

customer_reviews.title: cool rocket. I love the scale stuff
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, cool rocket. I love the scale stuff. I think it should be rated a skill level 4 or 5 though. Haven't flown it yet but I'm gonna soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Muir

customer_reviews.title: Damaged-still a awesome rocket.
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get this product. Came in the mail very fast. The only bad thing I have to say about this product is that it came smashed. The tube was crushed a little bit. The wood fins where also deformed a bit. It was fixable but was a little disappointed. I used a heavy book to mod the fins back flat and was able to get the motor mount to reform the tube. Other than bad luck, this is an awesome build. Would recomended this rocket to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this rocket to remain sealed until some year ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rocket to remain sealed until some year I am ready to build all of my saved kits. The package was expertly packed and will remain in its original package.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated
customer_reviews.text: The rocket's top assembly instructions unrealistic. There is no way a ten year-old or even an adult could put that together with glue.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Not assembled
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good looking rocket at the kids love however the red tower is near impossible to gour nicely and the fins are not that strong
customer_reviews.author: ED Weber

customer_reviews.title: awesome rocket.
customer_reviews.text: we plan on sending it to Amy Schumer's house so she can leave the planet after the inauguration.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: What was in the box did not match the description.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived without delay. Was fun to build. Will launch with my youngest son.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to assemble. Did not fly properly, parachute hardly operated. Not a good buy
customer_reviews.author: M E Curtin

product_meta.title: Estes 1921 Mercury Redstone Flying Model Rocket Kit
product_meta.description:
This is the mercury red stone flying model rocket by Estes.
includes: 
requires: White or yellow glue
finishing supplies
igniters (estt2301)
recovery wadding (estt2274)
launch controller (estt2220)
porta-pad II launch pad (estt2215)
fin alignment guide (Estt2231) - optional
engines: c6-3 (estt1613)
4 AA batteries (Fugp7300) - for Launch controller

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars132 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
